Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TAbstractSetFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TAbstractSetFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISetFactory, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TProgressiveSetFactory, TSimpleSetFactory
    public abstract class TAbstractSetFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISetFactory
    Abstract class providing standard, basic implementation of common methods for the ISetFactory interface. Who wants to provide a new heuristic to generate set of series, instead of directly implementing the ISetFactory interface, can sub-class TAbstracSetFactory inheriting all its "boiler-plate" implementations thus concentrating only on the core, differentiating, run() method implementation.
    Since:
    1.8
    See Also:
    ISetFactory, TSimpleSetFactory, TProgressiveSetFactory

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TAbstractSetFactory()
      Default constructor for the class. It leaves the object in the "INITIALIZING" status, because, even if default values are provided for the desired number of series, the maximum equal numbers allowed for cards and rows and the iterations limits (counter and milliseconds) for the generation heuristics, the user still have to set the seriesBuilder (TMakeSix instance), the logger (TLogger instance) and the series set (TSeriesList instance) that will contain the generated series of cards.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected int checkForStop()
      This is a protected, helper designed to be invoked within the run() method, likely in the inner series generation loop, to check if a process stop has been either externally requested by means of a requestStop() invocation or needed because at least one of the process limiting parameters have been reached.
      protected ISetFactory.TStatus checkInitialization()
      When created, an object implementing the ISetFactory interface is in the "INITIALIZIG" state, that is mandatory parameters and indispensable components still must be set. This method check is parameters have been properly set and consequently update the object status to "READY".
      int getDesideredSeries()
      Return the number of series to be generated as currently set.
      long getElapsedMillisecs()
      If the set factory object is in the RUNNING status, this method returns, in milliseconds, the time elapsed since the series generation process was started.
      long getIterationsLimit()
      Return the max number of single iterations allowed to complete the card generation.
      ILogger getLogger()
      Return the logger used by this set factory object.
      int getMaxEqualPerCard()
      Return the max equal number allowed per card.
      int getMaxEqualPerRow()
      Return the max equal number allowed per row.
      TMakeSix getSeriesBuilder()
      Return the TMakeSix object used by the heuristic to generate each series of six card.
      TSeriesList getSeriesList()
      Return the TSeriesList object containing the series generated by the heuristic.
      ISetFactory.TStatus getStatus()
      Return the current status of the factory object.
      long getTimeLimit()
      Return the timeout, in milliseconds, set in order to complete the card generation.
      void joinOnEnded()
      Invoke this method to block your execution and wait the completion (or the interruption) of the Java thread dedicated to the generation of the series of cards.
      void joinOnEnded​(long mSecsTimeout)
      Invoke this method to block your execution and wait either the completion (or the interruption) of the Java thread dedicated to the generation of the series of cards, or the timeout passed as input parameter.
      void requestStart()
      Invoke this method to start the set series generation process.
      void requestStop()
      Invoke this method to request the interruption of the series generation algorithm before it completes all desired series of cards.
      void setDesiredSeries​(int desiredNumSeries)
      Set the number of series that the heuristic will try to generate. This value must be set in the INITIALIZING status to enable the READY status, but usually can also be changed in the following RUNNING or STOPPED statuses.

      Set a maximum number of loop cycles that limit the execution of the series generation process.
      void setLogger​(ILogger logger)
      Set the TSimpleLogger object used by the generation heuristic to trace relevant events and errors. It can be set only during the INITIALIZING or READY phase, not in following statuses.

      Set the max equal numbers allowed per card.

      • getSeriesList

        public TSeriesList getSeriesList()
        Return the TSeriesList object containing the series generated by the heuristic. You can access to this list whenever you want, independently to the status the factory set is operating in. It is user responsibility do not modify this set during series generation (RUNNING status).
        Specified by:

      • setTimeLimit

        public void setTimeLimit​(long limitMilliSecs)
        Set an interval time that limit the execution of the series generation process. This is mainly done to prevent endless runs in case of too challenging values set for MaxEPC and/or MaxEPR quality indicators. If this limit is reached, the heuristic will initiate the stop processing.
        Specified by:
        setTimeLimit in interface ISetFactory
        Parameters:
        limitMilliSecs - the maximum execution time allowed for a run of series generation.

This is mainly done to prevent endless runs in case of too challenging values set for MaxEPC and/or MaxEPR quality indicators. If this limit is reached, the heuristic will initiate the stop processing.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • getElapsedMillisecs

        public long getElapsedMillisecs()
        If the set factory object is in the RUNNING status, this method returns, in milliseconds, the time elapsed since the series generation process was started.
        Specified by:
        getElapsedMillisecs in interface ISetFactory
        Returns:
        the time elapsed since the series generation process was started, or the complete duration of the process if it is already ended or has been stopped. Return zero if the series generation process has not started jet.

      • requestStart

        public void requestStart()
        Invoke this method to start the set series generation process. This method should be called only if the set factory is in the READY status, but it can be used also to re-start a process already in the STOPPED or COMPLETED status. It will instantiate a dedicated Java Thread (daemon type, so it will not block the whole Java virtual machine instance) to execute the process. The status of the set factory object is NOT changed. The Runnable.run() method has the responsibilities to change it from READY (or STOPPED, or COMPLETED) to RUNNING as one of its first instructions.
        Specified by:
        requestStart in interface ISetFactory

      • requestStop

        public void requestStop()
                 throws TTombolaRuntimeException
        Invoke this method to request the interruption of the series generation algorithm before it completes all desired series of cards. Interruption request should be examined within the Runnable.run() method (the factory is in RUNNING state) and the elaboration will be interrupted. The set factory object will be moved to the STOPPED status. A further invocation of the ISetFactory.requestStart() could typically re-start the process where it was interrupted.
        Specified by:
        requestStop in interface ISetFactory
        Throws:
        TTombolaRuntimeException

      • joinOnEnded

        public void joinOnEnded()
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                        TTombolaRuntimeException
        Invoke this method to block your execution and wait the completion (or the interruption) of the Java thread dedicated to the generation of the series of cards. This method works just like the Thread.join() method of the Java standard library.
        Specified by:
        joinOnEnded in interface ISetFactory
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - like the standard Java library Thread.join() method.
        TTombolaRuntimeException - to indicate a request to wait for a series generation process that has not been already started, has been already interrupted or is already completed.

      • joinOnEnded

        public void joinOnEnded​(long mSecsTimeout)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                        TTombolaRuntimeException
        Invoke this method to block your execution and wait either the completion (or the interruption) of the Java thread dedicated to the generation of the series of cards, or the timeout passed as input parameter. This method works just like the Thread.join(long) method of the Java standard library.
        Specified by:
        joinOnEnded in interface ISetFactory
        Parameters:
        mSecsTimeout - maximum wait time expressed in milliseconds after that the thread is un-blocked anyway.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - like the standard Java library Thread.join(long) method.
        TTombolaRuntimeException - to indicate a request to wait for a series generation process that has not been already started, has been already interrupted or is already completed.

      • getStatus

        public ISetFactory.TStatus getStatus()
        Description copied from interface: ISetFactory
        Return the current status of the factory object. Here a brief description of the intended meaning of each state follows:
        • status == INITIALIZING: there are still mandatory parameters and or component objects to be set;
        • status == READY: everything has been done in order to start the series generation;
        • status == RUNNING: algorithm is running, series are going to be generated;
        • status == STOPPING: the interruption of the process has been requested but the executor thread is still finalizing its things in order to definitively stop;
        • status == STOPPED: generation process has been forcedly interrupted. Desired number of series may have been not completely generated yet. Typically process can be also re-started;
        • status == COMPLETED: the process has naturally completed its execution. Desired series have been generated respecting MaxEPC/MaxEPR configured values.
        Specified by:
        getStatus in interface ISetFactory
        Returns:
        the current status of the set factory object (see: ISetFactory.TStatus)

      • checkInitialization

        protected ISetFactory.TStatus checkInitialization()
        When created, an object implementing the ISetFactory interface is in the "INITIALIZIG" state, that is mandatory parameters and indispensable components still must be set. This method check is parameters have been properly set and consequently update the object status to "READY". Specifically, following parameters and component objects are considered mandatory: the desired number of series, the TMakeSix instance used to build each series, the TSeriesList object that will contain all generated series, a TLogger instance where log relevant events and error messages, the maximum equal numbers allowed per card and per row, the guard limit counter for the heuristic iterations and the guard limit for the elapsed elaboration time, expressed in millisecond. The default constructor of this abstract class, TAbstractSetFactory(), does not provide defaults value, so the TombolaLib users must call all relevant setXXX method to let the object reach the "READY" state, thus enabling the invocation of the requestStart() method. Classes sub-classing TAbstractSetFactory can provide initial, defaults value overriding their default constructor, thus directly entering the "READY" state.
        Returns:
        the current status of the setFactory object
        See Also:
        TAbstractSetFactory()

      • checkForStop

        protected int checkForStop()
        This is a protected, helper designed to be invoked within the run() method, likely in the inner series generation loop, to check if a process stop has been either externally requested by means of a requestStop() invocation or needed because at least one of the process limiting parameters have been reached. It returns: -1 if the process is stopped due to an external call to the requestStop() method, -2 if the iteration limit has been reached, -3 if the timeout for the process has been reached. Return 0 is there is no reason to stop the process.
        Returns:
        -1 if the process is stopped due to an external call to the requestStop() method, -2 if the iteration limit has been reached, -3 if the timeout for the process has been reached. Return 0 is there is no reason to stop the process.
